item.description:
Details subject to refinement by Shivin!

Distance is approximately 13 miles, elevation gain is about 4000 feet.  Via the North Twin trail.


The plan is to hike out the North Twin trail to North Twin.  Assuming conditions are favorable, we will continue and try to reach South Twin and then return the way we came.

Snowshoes and crampons are an absolute must for this trip. Adequate clothing, including non cotton layers for head, face and hands is essential. Following trails in winter can be much more difficult, especially when there is fresh snow. As losing the trail is possible, it will be essential that we all stay together.

Description: This is challenging hike. We will be going above treeline, so you must come prepared for bad weather. Weather in the mountains is unpredictable. People have died from exposure hiking in the White Mountains in summer, so care and preparation are essential in winter. Snowshoes and crampons are an absolute must for this trip. Adequate clothing, including non cotton layers for head, face and hands is essential. Following trails in winter can be much more difficult, especially when there is fresh snow. As losing the trail is possible, it will be essential that we all stay together.

Necessary equipment:

BE PREPARED FOR HARSH WINTER CONDITIONS

• Headlamp (or flashlight) with spare batteries, or a second headlamp/flashlight. 
• Clothing: Layering will be important wool, synthetic or belnded shirt/pants - no jeans or cotton. Cotton does not insulate well when wet. Windy ridge conditions can compound this. Insulating layers will be essential.  You should be able to cover every centimeter of your skin if needed.
• Outerwear: Waterproof/windproof jacket (with hood or separate waterproof/windproof head covering) and extra insulation. Layers are essential as the exertion will generate a great deal of heat. Rain or ski pants will be important. 
• Food and Water: High-energy snacks and at least two quarts of water. 
• Other Gear: Sunscreen
• Trail hardy winter footwear. 
• Whatever you'd need to survive an unplanned night out in the mountains. 
* Anything else your experience, judgment or research tells you that you need. 
See the winter hiking gear and preparation discussion on the message board for more informaiton and ideas.

For more information please look for the list of 10 essentials, other gear and the Hiker Responsibility Code at http://www.hikesafe.c....

Car Pooling – Lets save some gas money and shrink our carbon footprint! If you have a ride to offer or need a ride please post your needs or availability on your RSVP. Please note your interest in giving or getting a ride and contact hikers directly if their posts or profiles indicate it might be convenient to share rides with them.

If interested in staying over near the trail head either Friday or Saturday night, please indicate this in your RSVP.

Please allow plenty of time and let me know ASAP if you are running late as cell phone coverage is not reliable. Having been burned by no shows a few times, I will not keep people waiting unless I am sure you are coming.

Pedxing DISCLAIMER: MY ROLE AS ORGANIZER IN THIS HIKE IS SOCIAL. I AM NOT TRAINED TO BE A GUIDE, NOR HAVE I RECEIVED TRAINING OR INSTRUCTION IN HIKING SAFETY. WHILE I TRY TO HEAD OFF SOME OF THE PROBLEMS I HAVE SEEN IN THE PAST, MY UNDERSTANDING IS THAT YOU WILL TAKE RESPONSIBILITY FOR YOUR OWN SAFETY. IF MY DISAPPEARANCE DURING THIS TRIP WOULD CAUSE YOU MORE THAN ANNOYANCE AND INCONVENIENCE, THIS IS NOT THE TRIP FOR YOU. THERE ARE ALWAYS RISKS IN HIKING IN THE MOUNTAINS. IF YOU ARE NOT CONFIDENT THAT YOU UNDERSTAND THE RISKS, PLEASE DO NOT SIGN UP (or change your RSVP to no). I AM PERFECTLY CAPABLE OF MAKING STUPID OR MINDLESS MISTAKES, SO PLEASE DO YOUR OWN RESEARCH AND COME PREPARED WITH APPROPRIATE KNOWLEDGE, EQUIPMENT AND JUDGMENT. HOPEFULLY WE'LL ALL HAVE SOME FUN AND ENJOY A GREAT HIKE IN GOOD COMPANY.

I'm coordinating the trip with Shivin who on the Boston Hiking Group.  If you are looking to share a ride, please check there as well.
